- 3/4 of new immigrants have done or are doing German courses
- 33% speak good or v good German, up from 18%
- 35% are in work
- 2011-16 migrants added €35 billion to the German economy

Source: @DIW_Berlin

1011244115588239363.text:
(3) If you don't know what Brand is, you can't hire for it. 

I pitched my job at almost every company I ever went to. Algolia was looking for a managing editor - they were extraordinary for what they gave me.

MadKudu explicitly invested in Brand from day one. That's very rare.

1011244113600110593.text:
(2) This job is not one job, it's three.

In this case, the company is looking for a PR rep, a designer, a content manager, and a campaign manager, all that "potentially with a small team in the future."

I can 0-to-1 on some of those things, but each of those is a team lead.

1011244112425766917.text:
(1) VP Branding isn't a title. 

VPs with Brand experience are either VP Marketing, VP Communications, or occasionally VP Brand for consumer products (which this company is not). 

If you're looking for VP Branding, you don't know what you're looking for.

984806321127067648.text: The stories are there, waiting to be written. Most of them only concern a French audience - so when I say @naddymess is the only reputable french tech news site (it’s a parody blog), prove me wrong by writing something that I didn’t also get in press release form in my inbox.

984806318656638977.text:
All the FrenchTech blogs hailed PrestaShop for hiring a female CEO, and only Frenchweb covered the change this year, without asking the question “what went wrong?” 

Instead we read about how we need more women in tech, instead of asking why women in leadership are leaving.

984806316559486976.text: Why don’t we read about how VivaTech bad mouthed startups in their internal communication tools if they aren’t paying stupid amounts of money for a stand?

984806314068070400.text: Where’s the article about @bnbsitter’s entire engineering team appearing on recruiting sites overnight?

984806312402997249.text:
Most french tech news sites are competing with AFP & major media to translating what they read in NYT/TC into French in order to get attention. There’s no unique perspective. 

Ironically, @bifrance, which openly translates its authors articles, has some of the best journalists.

984806310167371776.text: Don’t get me wrong, @romaindillet & @obrien do a great job, but their audience numbers (in France) Paul in comparison to all the “here’s what you missed this week” FrenchTech blogs.

984806308493905920.text:
In @cgiorgi’s Facebook group, the most common complaint is that there’s not enough “off the record” talk. 

But plenty of people will go on the record to credible journalists who earn the respect of their audience. 

We need more brand-name tech journalists.

984806302919593984.text:
The state of French-language tech news is, honestly, deplorable. I feel sorry for those who don’t have the luxury of being bilingual. 

French people shouldn’t have to turn to English-language news just to get an actual overview of what’s going on.

Where’s the journalism?https://twitter.com/liamboogar/status/984799166709805058 …

984779271938945024.text: Finally, a French-language tech news site worth reading: @naddymess.https://twitter.com/obrien/status/984775111986294784 …
